alert.note: Alert for Chatanika River Valley; Delta Junction; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Fortymile Country; Tanana Flats; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; Upper Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 5:14AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow continues Monday into Wednesday for the Interior... A strong frontal boundary is bringing snow and blowing snow over the northern Interior today. Gusty northeast winds of 25 to 40 mph will reduce visibility over higher terrain north of Fairbanks and along the Elliott, Steese and Dalton highways. The second shot of snow brings a better chance of accumulating snow for Fairbanks on Tuesday. Snow will develop around Fairbanks late Monday night and continue into Tuesday. 3 to 5 inches expected around the Fairbanks area, and 6 to 10 inches over the Eastern and Northern Interior and down the Parks Highway near Denali. Snow likely to linger into into Wednesday over the Interior. Also temperatures will moderate above zero for much of the area for the first half of the week.
